instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Graphic issue
threads.message:
Hello everybody

[ATTACH type="full" width="30%"]12527._xfImport[/ATTACH]

I m working on graphic issue like pictured (I dont know how can i describe it:)  , i  know it not cause from GPU because ASD pass and not freezing or like that. 

Tested know good complete LCD and cable with cover
Re soldered LVDS connector 
Reflow GPUMUX (<CHIP>U9600</CHIP>) 

where can check next step..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Graphic issue
threads.message:
It is an LVDS issue. Could be caused by anything in the LVDS circuit. So starting at GPU then MUX then coils then LCD connector. Give the GPU some heat and see if the problem disappears, not reflow just 100C or so.
By re-soldered LCD connector do you mean replaced?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Graphic issue
threads.message: Thanks Duke. Didnt replace connector yet but ll start from there. After GPU heat little bid.
